movies.title: Mercenaries' Trap
movies.plot: The movie is based on a true story from the end of WWI, in Transylvania. A nobleman who owned some land in Transylvania returns home to find a part of his fortune burned to ashes during late 1918 when power was trasfered from AustroHungary to Romania. Looking for revenge, he ordered the killing of innocent Romanian peasants from a neighbouring village, which he suspected to be guilty for the losses he suffered. A Romanian officer from Romanian Transylvanian Volunteers Corp, decides to help the villagers to face the menace of the nobleman.
movies.simplePlot: In 1918 a defeated Austro-Hungarian Baron Colonel Von Görtz returns home to Transylvania which has just been lost to Romania. A vengeful Von Görtz punishes the nearby villagers but Romanian Major Tudor Andrei aids them.

biography.bio: Gheorghe Cozorici was born on July 16, 1933 in Arbore, Suceava, Romania. He is known for his work on Mercenaries' Trap (1981), Stephen the Great - Vaslui 1475 (1975) and Fratii Jderi (1974). He died on December 18, 1993 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Gheorghe Cozorici

biography.bio: Sergiu Nicolaescu was born on the 13th of April 1930, in Targu Jiu, Gorj County, Romania. Nicolaescu, the 'Steven Spielberg of the Romanian cinema', was a brilliant, self-taught technician and a master of popular entertainment who approached during his long career various genres with great success. In his childhood, he spent a lot of time at the cinema. He was inspired by the films and played "war" or "mystery" games with 30 fellow kids in the suburbs of his native town. His father was an engineer, who worked for King Michael. Therefore, after the King's abdication in 1947, his father was arrested. After finishing high school, Nicolaescu was accepted by three colleges. He finally attended the Romanian Marine Corps. Nicolaescu entered the realm of cinema by chance. A friend offered him a job in the Bucharest Studios of that time. He didn't expect a career in directing, but his poetic short film The Memory of the Rose (1964) got a lot of attention at the 1962 Cannes International Film Festival. In 1967, his massive domestic success The Dacians (1966) became the first Romanian hit film in Western Europe. Subsequently, Nicolaescu was internationally appreciated as a film director of large scale period films. He had the privilege to work in France, Germany and other countries on several projects in the 70s and 80s. He directed Michael the Brave (1970) and Then I Sentenced Them All to Death (1972), two of the most successful and best Romanian epics. He also was responsible for such indigenous blockbusters as The Immortals (1974),Cu mâinile curate (1972),Noi, cei din linia întîi (1985) and Proud Heritage (1989). His only, but very popular, comedy Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979) sold a record 14.6 mill. tickets in Romania, more than any other film in communist Romania. After the Romanian Revolution in Dec. 1989, Nicolaescu became a political figure, but continued to direct movies. Without the free assistance of the Romanian military, he couldn't produce epics as he did back in the Communist era. Oglinda (1994) and The Death Triangle (1999) were smaller in scale, but well-received at the box-office. While most of his epic films were only possible within the nationalist context of Communist Romania, they are still appreciated today by audiences as timeless, spectacular entertainments on a massive scale. One of his fans included director Steven Spielberg himself, who even included clips from a battle scene in "Mihai Viteazul" into E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982).
biography.name: Sergiu Nicolaescu

biography.bio: Mircea Albulescu was born on October 4, 1934 in Bucharest, Romania as Iorgu Constantin Albulescu. He was an actor, known for Actorul si salbaticii (1975), Michael the Brave (1970) and For Motherland (1977). He was married to Maria. He died on April 8, 2016 in Bucharest.
biography.name: Mircea Albulescu

biography.bio: Ion Besoiu was born on March 11, 1931 in Sibiu, Sibiu, Romania. He was an actor, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Bucharest Non Stop (2015) and Toate pînzele sus (1976). He died on January 18, 2017 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Ion Besoiu

biography.bio: Amza Pellea was born on April 7, 1931 in Bailesti, Dolj, Romania. He was an actor and writer, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979) and The Punishment (1976). He died on December 12, 1983 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Amza Pellea

biography.bio: Jean Constantin was born on August 21, 1928 in Techirghiol, Constanta County, Romania. He was an actor, known for Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979), Duelul (1981) and Toate pînzele sus (1976). He died on May 26, 2010 in Constanta, Romania.
biography.name: Jean Constantin

biography.bio: Colea Rautu was born on November 18, 1912 in Balti, Russian Empire as Nikolai Rutkovski. He was an actor, known for Duelul (1981), Michael the Brave (1970) and Apachen (1973). He died on May 13, 2008 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Colea Rautu

biography.bio: Corneliu Gîrbea was born on September 5, 1928 in Gheorghieni, Romania. He is an actor, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979) and Mercenaries' Trap (1981).
biography.name: Corneliu Gîrbea

biography.bio: Klaus Gehrke was born on May 27, 1939 in Neustrelitz, Germany. He is an actor and assistant director, known for The Country Doctor (1987), Rote Bergsteiger (1968) and Schöner Leben (2006).
biography.name: Klaus Gehrke

biography.bio: Serban Ionescu was born on September 23, 1950 in Corabia, Jud. Olt, Romania. He was an actor, known for Maria (2003), 15 (2005) and Ion: Blestemul pamîntului, blestemul iubirii (1980). He was married to Magda Catone. He died on November 21, 2012 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Serban Ionescu

biography.bio: Traian Costea is an actor, known for Mercenaries' Trap (1981), Artista, dolarii si Ardelenii (1978) and Proud Heritage (1989).
biography.name: Traian Costea

biography.bio: Constantin Rautchi was born on May 22, 1934 in Bucharest, Romania. He was an actor, known for Redhead (1976), Prin cenusa imperiului (1978) and Brigada Diverse intrã în actiune (1970). He died on November 17, 1984 in Bucharest.
biography.name: Constantin Rautchi

biography.bio: Constantin Codrescu was born on September 5, 1931 in Husi, Falciu, Romania. He is an actor, known for Le moulin de la chance (1957), Train of Life (1998) and Michael the Brave (1970).
biography.name: Constantin Codrescu

biography.bio: Mircea Gogan is an actor, known for Mercenaries' Trap (1981), Impossible Love (1984) and Vacanta la mare (1963).
biography.name: Mircea Gogan

biography.bio: George Mihaita was born on September 23, 1948 in Moreni, Romania. He is an actor and director, known for Au diable Staline, vive les mariés! (2008), Reconstruction (1968) and Palaria (2004). He is married to Delia Seceleanu.
biography.name: George Mihaita
